abstract: Because of problems with Medtronic’s heart defibrillators, the F.D.A. said it plans to examine whether its current tests are sufficient to catch electrical problems in the devices.
snippet: Because of problems with Medtronic’s heart defibrillators, the F.D.A. said it plans to examine whether its current tests are sufficient to catch electrical problems in the devices.
lead_paragraph: The Food and Drug Administration is likely to study whether to require more extensive tests of critical heart-device components before they are sold, as a result of Medtronic’s recent problems with such a product, an agency official said yesterday.

headline.main: Tests of Heart Devices to Get Review
headline.print_headline: Tests of Heart Devices to Get Review
